meanings.sent1: Don't be a clodpoll and forget your umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the clodpoll for not paying attention in class.
meanings.sent3: The clodpoll thought a tomato was a vegetable, not a fruit!
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness made him a clodpoll in the eyes of his friends.
meanings.sent5: Being a clodpoll in math class, he struggled to solve even simple problems.

meanings.definition: To strike someone on the head.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally clodpolled his brother while playing with a toy sword.
meanings.sent2: The boxer aimed to clodpoll his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to clodpoll him with a pillow during their pillow fight.
meanings.sent4: The falling branch seemed to clodpoll the hiker on the trail.
meanings.sent5: The chef's knife slipped, nearly clodpolling his finger instead of the vegetables.
